u.a: Wawrzon looks through the window. He sees the moving concrete mixer and says [this utterance]. mother tries to make him describe what he sees through the window and tells him about different objects outside .
Wawrzon looks at the bag with the tape recorder and points to the window sill .
(do) not hold (it) . on the window (sill) . put (it) on the window (sill) .
NEG|not unk#V|hold-IMP:2S PREP|on N|window-NEUT:ACC:S PREP|on N|window-NEUT:LOC:S V|put .
Wawrzon starts looking through the window again .
it is impossible to determine if he wanted to say "beton leje się" (concrete is pouring out) or "betoniarka leje beton" (the concrete mixer is pouring concrete) .
can you see how it is moving ?
Wawrzon is not interested in the crane any more . he is looking at the concrete mixer .
it is impossible to determine is he wanted to say "sypie się beton" (concrete is pouring out) or "betoniarka sypie beton" (the concrete mixer is pouring concrete) .
and people are working there right ?
not here . there in the back . over there right ?
Wawrzon stops looking through the window, he comes to his book and turns the pages of the book, he points to the picture .
(she) is flying up on her broom .

Wawrzon turns the page and points to the picture .
you climbed on the window sill after all, and it's not allowed . the window may get smashed .
I hope it wońt get smashed but it could .
Wawrzon wants his mom to hold him .
"and flirting cocks". show me the little cocks .
show me the little ducks now .
here it is . here (are) little turkeys .
do you know this man with a beard ?
I knoow the man . he is pouring water there . he is pouring water from the bathroom .

and where is he pouring this water ?
WAW hears the sound of the concrete mixer and immediately goes to the window .
you cańt see anything any more, is that right ?
because it's dark . what is shining over there ?
do you know what it is ?
a little light is shining at the construction site .
the light is on at the construction site, too .
but in this house there, you can see, the light is also on .
and who is there in this house ?
dońt you have a friend in this house ?
but which one of your friends lives there ?
shall I read you about this ashen trunk ?
Hanna shows Wawrzon a picture of a cock .
Wawrzon sits in grandmother's lap and suddenly says:
I wanted to go to Michał .

Grandmother is trying to make him forget about Michał and asks him some questions concerning his visit to a car-wash .
Grandmother whispers and her utterances cannot be understood . Wawrzon repeats the last part of each sentence .
and (were) closing . (I) was sitting ... closed ... quietly ... in the car-wash .

but I dońt have a tape recorder .
Wawrzon points to the bag with the tape recorder .
Mother comes back . Wawrzon goes into the corridor .
Wawrzon repeats the last part of Hanna's sentence .
I wanted to go to Bazio .

Mother tries to interest him in something else .
and do you know the girlś names ?
Wawrzon points to the tape recorder .
Wawrzon points to the tape recorder .
but it isńt a tape recorder . it is a bag .
give me the bag . give (me) the bag mommy .

and what are you going to do with the bag ?
but a bag cannot be turned on .
it (is) the tape recorder . (I) wanted to turn (it) on .
Mother tries to focus his attention on toys but he does not respond .
no, I wanted to go to Bazio .

after a while . Wawrzon returns to the room and carries a small glass with him .
what a prettty glass . (is) it yours ?
Wawrzon repeats the last part of Kasia's sentence . he should say "to moja" (it is mine) .
Mother is holding a bottle with juice . Wawrzon stretches his hand with the glass asking for juice .
did you go shopping with mommy ?
Mother pours some juice into his glass . Wawrzon drinks and once more stretches his hand with the glass .
but not so fast . dońt drink so fast . you are done areńt you ?
Wawrzon goes to the window . he kneels on the window sill .
he wants Hanna to open the window .
I dońt know if (one) can open it . ask mommy if (one) can .
(one) cańt open the window you know it .
if you open the big one you will fall out . and you know how high it is there .
Mother tries to make him forget about the tape recorder .
can you see this big light ?
he wants his mother to take him in her arms .
and in this way he is closer and closer to his target .
Mother means that Wawrzon wanted to be closer to the tape recorder .
but it isńt our tape recorder . we cańt play with it .
Mother tries to turn his attention to something else . she tries to play with Wawrzon but he ignores her and comes back to his book .
Wawrzon turns the pages of the book .
and dońt you know this story ?
she shows him a picture of a dog .
all of the sudden a ball coming from the corridor appears in the room . Grandmother has thrown it .
the ball has flown in (by) itself ?
Mother asks Wawrzon some questions concerning the book but he does not pay attention to her words .
well what is it that can strike ?
Hanna wants Warzon to tell her the missing word .
he points to the picture of a clock .
Hanna is reading and asking Wawrzon questions .
bim bom . how does the clock strike ?
and what else strikes like that ?
yes a clock . and also bells strike bim bom bom dońt they ?
(they) toll . in church the bells toll .

that's right . and who else is in the church ?
in the church the bells toll right ?
Wawrzon does not respond to Mother's words .
but this is an old hag .
Hanna is reading the story and then asking Wawrzon a question .
Wawrzon points to the picture of a shoe . Hanna reads the next story .
and do you know what brown bread is ?
and here Wawrzuś already knows this story .
Hanna is reading . Wawrzon completes the sentences with appropriate rhymes .
a bee is flying to Wojtaszek's +...
a wasp is flying to Wojtaszek's +...
a fly is flying to Wojtaszek's ...
well where is the fly flying ?
it should be "do Wojtaszka nosa" (to Wojtaszek's nose) . if the rhyme were to be preserved Warzon should say "do Wojtaszka ucha" (to Wojtaszek's ear) .
Hanna is reading . Mother asks Wawrzon a question .
you told (us) what story this is .
it is the title of one of the stories .
this isńt "baju baju". look what it is .
see . you know these stories so are you checking if auntie can read ?
does auntie know how to read ?
Hanna is reading . Wawrzon notices a ring on her finger .
he means "co tu ma" (what does she have here) .
Hanna is reading . then she stops .
tell us what is on this table .
cańt you guess from the picture what it is ?
and this is about a wolf .
he stained the little suits . the hippo stained kangarooś suits . and here ?
an ostrich, an ostrich, a kitten .
ok, it can be a kitten .
well, Zoo . there are animals in the Zoo .
KAT goes out of the room with the tape recorder .
after coming back KAT tries to shift Wawrzońs attention to something else .
well, I dońt know where he is . has uncle Dick been here today ?
Wawrzon holds a dirty tissue in his hand .
I'll throw it away, this tissue . I'll give you a new one .
Wawrzon runs to the other room . then he comes back . he wants the tape recorder he saw in the other room .

but which tape recorder should I give you ?
and what are you going to do with this tape recorder ?
I was turning it on and it was turning around .

give me the tape recorder . the little tape recorder .
I cańt give it to you because I cańt take this big trunk down, you know ?
well, I cańt take this trunk down because it's very heavy .
Wawrzon sometimes repeats the adult's utterance without changing the form of the verb . mother pretends she understood his words literally .
if you can, then go get it .
that tape recorder from the top .
where is the tape recorder on the top ?
they go to the other room .
there . the tape recorder from the top .

do you remember what daddy said ?
that you cańt play with the phonograph because the record has worn out .
I cańt, it's too heavy for me . I wońt take it down .
I wanted to listen to the tape recorder .
the genitive case of "magnetofon" has a different ending from its diminutive counterpart "magnetofonik":"magnetofon-u", but "magnetofonik-a".
but I cańt take it down, sonny .
it is such a heavy trunk that three people have to take it down .
you wońt be able to listen because there is no crank and if there is no crank you cańt wind it up .
mother takes a toy dog and goes with Wawrzon to the other room . they read a book .
it's the title of a story .
it's a fragment of the text .
the wind laments, laments, it's a long long way home .
here is the cat called Mruczek .
MOT compares the toy dog to the one in the picture .
Wawrzon picks up his toy dog and looks at it .
I tore the doggy's tail off .
why did you tear its tail off ?
Wawrzon is pulling on the dog's ears .
dońt tear off its ears or it will be ugly, you know ?
MOT is playing with the dog .
it is going for a walk .
yes . I wanted (to go) to MIchał .
is the doggy going to Michał ?
I cańt take you there, it's very far .
Trabant is an East German made car .
Janusz . I wanted to go to MIchał .

you would be running like crazy again .
go and bring an apple from the kitchen .
I dońt know what happened to this tail .
Wawrzon goes to the kitchen and asks his grandmother for an apple .
Wawrzon is walking back with the apple . it falls on the floor .
Wawrzon enters the room with a knife and an apple in his hand .
MOT wants to help Wawrzon cut the apple but he wants to do it himself .
WAW tries to divide the apple into pieces .
you wońt open it like this, mom will cut it a little so that you can open it .
MOT helps WAW cut the apple .
I'll peel it for you, you know .
MOT wants WAW to play with the toys .
I dońt know, look for it .
Waw names the animals painted on the bus .
an ostrich, a monkey . the monkey is riding .

and here, and here, and here .

MOT imitates Wawrzońs pronunciation of the word kangaroo .
a fox with a beautiful collar .
WAW suddenly goes to the window .
outside the window . I can hear the window panes squeaking .
they are still working there, areńt they ?
it got dark . where is the concrete mixer ?
can you see this concrete mixer ?
a crane is standing, can you see ?
this arm is lifting, can you see ?
what is this concrete mixer doing ?
the obligatory context calls for the present tense .
Hanna is reading and Wawrzon repeats the last part of the sentence .
and do you know who this is ?
and what is this cricket doing ?
and what does it have here ?
HAN asks WAW some questions but he does not respond .
and you know this story . where is this bee flying ?
and what does this bee want to do ?
well, whom does it want to hit ?
the verb should have been reflexivized .
and you know this story . tell me what story it is .
"Baju baju" is the title of the story .
you cańt read this, these are pictures .
the bell rings and WAW goes to see who has come .
WAW comes back to his room with a tea strainer in his hand .
WAW means to say "nie ukłuję się" (I wońt prick myself) .
WAW pretends that the tea strainer is an arrow .
is this the way you get in bed ?
WAW gets out of bed . suddenly, he goes to the kitchen .
we'll grind coffee for daddy . we'll grind for daddy .

MOT gives WAW three cookies, two of them are for KAT and HAN . WAW gives the cookies to them .
WAW is in the other room and talks to his mother .
WAW goes to the other room and wants to switch on the light .
MOT wants WAW to invite HAN and KAT to the other room for tea .

is this aunt also to go ?
they go to the other room .
look what a belly you have from eating cookies .
MOT finds cookie crumbs on WAW's pants . Wawrzon wants to give them to the birds .
I'll throw this out to birds .
